RT @markeltro: This is about a lot more than the smell of a landfill. Emissions of hydrogen sulphide are way in excess of WHO guidelines. T‚Ä¶

@SalmonTroutCons have published a really eye-opening report on the protection of our waterways. They ask ‚Äòis the @EnvAgency doing it‚Äôs job?‚Äô The answer is no, but it could do it better with some legal reform and regulation updates from Government. To me it seems obvious (1/3)

urls.title: Mitigating The Havoc Caused By Floods | Ground Control And The Environment Agency | Ground Control
urls.description: By Ian Cooper, Senior Contract Manager, Ground Control, Philip Munslow, Waterways Operations Manager, Environment Agency As Storm Christoph recently demonstrated, mitigating the havoc caused by floods, (something that‚Äôs likely to be made even more commonplace by climate change), is more important than ever. This presents those of us tasked with flood prevention with an interesting conundrum ‚Äì can we continue to build flood defences or do we have to look at lower-carbon alternative solutions? In reality, flood defence assets are just one part of the Environment Agency‚Äôs overall strategy for managing high water levels. There are crucial steps we need to...
